intro: Peucedanum galbanum var. incisodentatum, commonly known as the narrow-toothed angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are valued for their medicinal properties, containing volatile oils and other bioactive compounds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils.
